Definition: In this task, you will be given a passage and a question. You will need to answer the question based on your understanding of the events inferred from the passage. Among the entities mentioned in the passage, try to find the best entity that is most likely to fill in the blank. Classify the answers based on the given options.

Positive Examples.input:
For four years we have waited expectantly for the pitter patter of tiny paws. Soon, that wait could finally be over. Tian Tian, the UK's only female giant panda, has conceived and could give birth to a cub as early as August. However Edinburgh Zoo, where the pandas live, have warned people 'not to get too excited' as the process is 'extremely complex'. Moreover, on the two previous occasions keepers inseminated Tian Tian - whose name means 'Sweetie' - she has failed to produce a panda cub. She was artificially inseminated again in March this year, but keepers at the zoo say implantation - when a fertilised egg attaches to the uterus - has not yet occurred.Tian Tian has conceived and could give birth to a cub as early as AugustShe has been inseminated twice before but so far failed to produce a cubTian Tian and Yang Guang arrived in 2011 from China to great fanfareOn loan at £600k a year, became first giant pandas to live in UK for 17 years 
 Questions:Under the terms of the agreement any cubs will return to _ at the age of two, the age at which they would normally leave their mother in the wild. (A) Tian Tian (B) UK (C) Edinburgh Zoo (D) Sweetie (E) Yang Guang (F) China
Positive Examples.explanation: This is a good example. Based on the passage, any cubs will return to China at the age of two

Positive Examples.input:
Manchester United did make an ambitious bid to sign Barcelona forward Neymar in the summer, according to the Brazil international's father. It has been widely reported that Louis van Gaal attempted to bring the 23-year-old to Old Trafford in the final weeks of the transfer window, with Neymar admitting that there had been discussions about a possible switch. Manchester United's desperate scramble for new striker after allowing Robin van Persie, Radamel Falcao and Javier Hernandez to all leave the club, led to them being linked with a host of players, including Bayern Munich forward Thomas Muller. United eventually parted with £36million for French teenager Anthony Martial from Monaco but, according to Neymar's father Neymar da Silva Santos, only after they had failed with a bid to lure his son away from the Nou Camp.Manchester United were widely reported to have bid for Neymar in summerThe player's father has confirmed that the Old Trafford club did make offerThe Brazil international is ready to open talks over a new deal at Barcelona 
 Questions:'_'s offer came to Barça and they told us they won't sell,' Neymar Snr is quoted as saying by Brazilian newspaper Globo. (A) Manchester United (B) Barcelona (C) Neymar (D) Brazil (E) Louis van Gaal (F) Old Trafford (G) Robin van Persie (H) Radamel Falcao (I) Javier Hernandez (J) Bayern Munich (K) Thomas Muller (L) French (M) Anthony Martial (N) Monaco (O) Neymar da Silva Santos (P) Nou Camp
Positive Examples.explanation: Based on the given passage, option (A) is correct.

Instances.input:
Britain's last Guantanamo Bay detainee Shaker Aamer is expected to be freed as early as June, according to US government sources. In a development which will hearten his family, officials in Washington said the 48-year-old is likely to be released in the summer after 13 years in captivity without charge or trial. It came as the man appointed by President Barack Obama to speed up the closure of the notorious prison camp said there was ‘no sound reason’ for keeping the terror suspect locked up any longer. British Guantanamo Bay detainee Shaker Aamer (pictured) is expected to be freed in June, US government sources have revealed. He is pictured right and left with son Michael and daughter, JohninhShaker Aamer has been held at Guantanamo without charge for 13 yearsThe 48-year-old, from London, could be freed in June, it has been revealedUS President Barack Obama has repeatedly vowed to close the facility 
 Questions:‘_ has always been a complete travesty of justice and whoever is in government must ensure... Shaker is returned to his family as soon as possible if he’s not going to be charged.’ (A) Britain (B) Guantanamo Bay (C) Shaker Aamer (D) US (E) Washington (F) Barack Obama (G) British (H) Michael (I) Johninh (J) London

(CNN) President Donald Trump on Thursday asked April Ryan, an African-American reporter and longtime White House correspondent, if she would arrange for him a meeting with the Congressional Black Caucus. Late in a rollicking and unexpected news conference, Trump took a question from Ryan, who asked about his campaign promise to revitalize the American urban centers he frequently described in bleak terms. Trump responded first by telling Ryan that her question was "very professional and very good," then claimed he received "a much higher percentage of the African-American vote than a lot of people thought" because of his attention to the "inner cities."Trump took a question from Ryan"Do you want to set up the meeting?" Trump asked 
 Questions:After the news conference, _ tweeted that she is "a journalist not a convener!. (A) CNN (B) Donald Trump (C) Ryan (D) African (E) American (F) White House (G) Congressional Black Caucus (H) Trump

Sporting legend Tim Henman retired from playing professional tennis in 2007 but he's headed back to the court with a giant tennis ball and two little helpers to launch a Wimbledon themed treasure hunt. Ahead of the Championships, which start on June 28, the 40-year-old former British No. 1 is encouraging families up and down the country to get active and take part in the Great Robinson Ball Hunt, which could see them win one of 30 VIP day tickets. Oxford-born Tim, who has three children - Rose Elizabeth, 12, Olivia Susan, 10, and seven-year-old Grace - with TV producer wife Lucy, has also spoken out about how important it is that his family lead a healthy lifestyle.Former British number one said he encourages his three daughters to 'lead a really active lifestyle'Says Rose Elizabeth, 12, Olivia Susan, 10, and seven-year-old Grace like tennis but also play hockey, netball and gymnasticsTim, who was once no. 4 in the world, has launched a SW19 treasure huntWimbledon tournament starts at the All England Tennis Club on Monday 
 Questions:'At this time of the year, there is a massive amount of interest around tennis and _ and Robinsons has been sponsoring the Championships for 80 years this year, not to mention the fact that I have been working with Robinsons for nearly 20 years!'. (A) Sporting (B) Tim Henman (C) Wimbledon (D) Championships (E) British No (F) Great Robinson Ball Hunt (G) Oxford (H) Tim (I) Rose Elizabeth (J) Olivia Susan (K) Grace (L) Lucy (M) British (N) SW19 (O) All England Tennis Club
